content.description: Python interpreter, lambda (2016 Fall, Final, Question 15 f)

p.line: Interpreter fun! For each, choose ONE that best matches what would display on the next line.
Note that some of the code might have bugs! We include "Error" and "None of these" in case the output is not what is expected.

We're trying to make a histogram function that returns the count of every item in data, for example histogram([7,8,8,8,9]) _RARR_ {7:1, 8:3, 9:1}. Check the box for every syntax or logical error you find.

content.hint: Try it out on your command line / terminal, using Python interpreter. "define" isn't "def". Comment should use "#". Don't forget ":". "foreach" is not "for". "report" is not "return". Besides, becareful the logic error.
